data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly for Antitrust Violations
data.Description: A federal judge ruled that Google maintains an illegal monopoly in the internet search market due to anticompetitive practices, including paying billions to companies like Apple to remain the default search engine.

data.Title: Apple Confirms Maintaining a Large Search Index
data.Description: Documents revealed during the Google antitrust case indicate that Apple maintains its own search index encompassing "billions" of websites, though the exact figure remains undisclosed.

data.Title: Safari Will Not Replace Google with Bing, Even for a Significant Sum
data.Description: Apple has firmly stated that it will not switch Safari's default search engine from Google to Bing, even if Microsoft offered the entire company as compensation.  Apple cites Bing's poor quality and monetization compared to Google.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Now Feature Photos
data.Description: Google Local Service Ads will now display photos from advertisers' profiles, potentially improving ad rank and visibility.

data.Title: Google Tests Changes to Video Search Results Navigation
data.Description: Google is experimenting with redirecting users to a dedicated "Short Videos" tab when they click "More Videos," instead of dynamically loading additional videos within the current search results.

data.Title: Google Ads API Version 17.1 Released
data.Description: Google Ads API version 17.1 is now available, introducing new features and updates for advertisers and developers.

data.Title: Google Search Testing "You May Like" Snippet Labels
data.Description: Google is testing a new label in search results snippets called "You May Like," potentially indicating personalized recommendations based on user browsing history or preferences.

data.Title: Google Ads Glitch Sends Million-Dollar Credit Notices
data.Description: A bug in Google Ads resulted in inaccurate credit notifications being sent to advertisers, with some receiving notices for millions of dollars in credits. Google has acknowledged the issue and is working on a resolution.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces Site Improvement Recommendations
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new recommendations feature that provides site improvement suggestions based on data analysis, aiming to enhance website performance in search results.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be migrating the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns in the coming months, offering enhanced features and benefits to advertisers.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report Missing Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report is no longer displaying the "call" tab, which provided statistics and data on calls generated from Google Search and Maps. This issue is suspected to be related to the recent removal of Google Business Profile call history.

data.Title: Google Ads Tests Displaying Advertiser Names in Call Extensions
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new call extension ad format that includes the advertiser's name below the clickable phone number, potentially increasing visibility and click-through rates.

data.Title: Google Ads Experimented with Serving Ads from Other Merchants
data.Description: The recent Google Ads reporting outage was caused by a deliberate shutdown after Google served ads for products from incorrect Google Merchant Center accounts. This issue affected ad spend, privacy, and data for some advertisers, and Google plans to issue credits to those impacted.

data.Title: Google Trends Unveils Redesigned Trending Now Page
data.Description: Google Trends has introduced a new design for its trending now page, offering enhanced filter options and providing more keyword data within a single view.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Testing "See Also" Carousel on Local Listings
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a "see also" carousel on Google Business Profiles, potentially displaying competitor suggestions directly beneath a business's local listing.
